file_content.text: Always a pleasure.
There is a shuttle awaiting you in the docking bay.
I have come for Darth Marr. Is he here?
Mighty Wrath. Follow me, please.
Dark Lord. Follow me, please.
Darth Marr sent for me. Has he arrived?
He will be here presently, Commander. Follow me.
He is on his way. Please follow me.
Shuttle Fuliginous en route to docking bay eight. Nonessential personnel must clear the area.
There is strength in this chamber. Let it suffice for the task ahead.
Tell no one of this meeting, hunter. You are about to hear a truth that very few are aware of.
Our last chance--our only chance--is far from the front lines. The planet Makeb is the secret to victory, and its responsibility is yours.
An unaligned colony world on the edge of Hutt Space... why does it matter? And why now?
I'm not familiar with Makeb.
The Empire's not the only place I can find work. What if I don't want your responsibility?
Maybe I should switch sides.
If you intended to leave, you would have done so. Depart now, and I may still allow it.
You summoned me. Why not take charge of this operation yourself?
My responsibility? Not yours?
Tens of thousands die to buy us time here, and I must lead the fleet. It is not as I would wish.
Makeb grew rich from mining and trade, becoming a neutral paradise for wealthy cretins. It escaped the war due to its tactical insignificance.
But now the Hutt Cartel has seized Makeb for itself. The Hutts believe that with our "imminent defeat," the time has come to chase glory.
The Hutts are greedy, but they're not fools. Makeb is important to them somehow.
They chose Makeb for a reason.
The Cartel's former Supreme Mogul tried to claim new territory. He gave the Cartel a taste for conquest.
I know the Hutts' ambitions.
Agreed. But there's more to it this time.
The Hutts are ambitious, but they're not militant. What's the Cartel thinking?
The Hutts? Going to war?
The Hutts had an empire long ago. Many dream of its return.
Why worry about a future threat when the Republic is on the verge of taking Korriban?
That isn't our concern.
Because what no one knows is this:
The Hutts chose Makeb not for its wealth, but for a substance called "isotope-5"--a mineral capable of twisting gravity and electromagnetic fields.
The Hutts have kept it a secret, but one gram could provide a near-infinite power source. Isotope-5 could remake the Hutts into a force to rival the Republic.
The Hutts find isotope-5, we take it from them... and the Empire gains a new weapon.
Then isotope-5 must be ours.
If the Hutts are keeping isotope-5 a secret, where did you get this information?
How did you learn this?
The Empire has been monitoring Hutt activity on the planet. This effort has borne fruit.
You said the former Minister of Intelligence set up surveillance on Makeb. Was that our source?
My people discovered this?
Yes. Both electronic wiretaps and human informants provided this information; we are confident.
The Republic can't be defeated with technology alone. If it could, we'd have won by now.
Tactics win wars, not weapons.
A fair complaint, but now only a combination of tactics and weaponry can save us.
Despite the efforts of the Hutts' mercenaries, Makeb's leaders are requesting aid from the Republic, and the planet is on the verge of chaos.
You must steal the Hutts' stockpile of isotope-5 under cover of the conflict. Stealth is paramount--if the Hutts and Republic realize your intent, they will deploy overwhelming force.
I am the Wrath of the Emperor. There is no soldier, Sith or machine that is my equal. Send me to Makeb, and that world will fall.
I'm the only army we need.
The military is under your control, Lord Marr. Do not make me regret leaving the galaxy in your hands.
See to the war while I'm gone.
We both have much to lose.
I haven't survived this long by making my actions public. But you know that already.
I prefer stealth, anyway.
I have learned what you are capable of.
Stealing from the Hutt Cartel earns you a galactic death mark. I'm in.
I never liked Hutts anyway.
What about allies? A base of operations?
Will I have any backup?
You will have a limited support team--specialists capable of performing their duty and willing to serve you unto death.
But in short, you will be alone on a hostile world. With our lines crumbling, we cannot mount a full-scale invasion.
Sending me to an isolated planet on a secret mission, surrounded by foes? You want me out of the way.
You're arranging my death.
We were destroyed by paranoia and infighting once! I will not allow that to happen again! Not with the Emperor silent.
My lord. You're needed with the Khar Delban fleet.
There is a cloaked shuttle waiting to deliver you to the surface. You may establish an uplink to your team once you land.
Be wary, and move with subtlety. If you fail, the Empire's last stand will be over before it begins.
Forgive me. I have no instructions related to your arrival.
So it shall be.
Lord Nox. Time is short, so let us begin with truth.
Lord Occlus. Time is short, so let us begin with truth.
Lord Imperius. Time is short, so let us begin with truth.
Malgus the Betrayer and the Dread Masters were cracks in the Empire's steel; the Republic is the coming hammer.
The Empire is losing this war. Barring the unexpected or the miraculous, our total defeat will occur within the year.
Between infighting among the Sith and military incompetence, it's sheer luck the Empire survived this long.
That's no surprise to anyone.
We won the battles on Corellia and Ilum. We should be stronger than ever.
How is that possible?
Our victories were glorious. But infighting among the Sith has taken its toll.
That may have been true once. But now I sit on the Dark Council, and I will bring the unexpected.
My ascension changes things.
Your tone is not welcome. Your sentiment is correct.
Darth Malgus sought to usurp the Emperor, and caused division when unity was required. The Republic sees an opportunity to strike.
Power plays have diminished the Dark Council. The Republic stands united while we bicker amongst ourselves.
Confidence is not strength.
If the Empire is this close to falling, why hasn't the Emperor intervened? Darth Malgus claimed he was dead....
What of the Emperor himself?
If the Empire is this close to falling, why hasn't the Emperor intervened? Darth Malgus claimed he was dead....
What of the Emperor himself?
Darth Malgus claimed many things. The Emperor remains silent, as is his right--but rumors of his demise have made our enemies bold.
The Emperor has been silent for many years, and that is his prerogative. But rumors of his absence have made our enemies bold.
Wrath. Time is short, so I will be blunt.
The Empire does not fall easily. You dare much, to accuse us of weakness.
You come speaking treason.
Or we die.
So why am I here?
You won on Corellia and Ilum. I was there. You should be stronger than ever.
How is that possible?
That's bad news. But you need an army, not one woman.
That's bad news. But you need an army, not one man.
You are not here to fight the war at all.
None must know what I am here to say. I will trust your discretion.
At least you're being candid. But I assume we're not here to surrender.
I appreciate your honesty.
Death before surrender. But today is not our day to die.
I did not expect such candor from the Dark Council. We must move swiftly, then.
A bold admission.
The Sith slaughter one another while our people are leaderless. That is weakness.
Yes. But the obstacles are many.
